intro: Phthirusa lepidobotrys, commonly known as the velvetleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains latex, which can cause skin irritation. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Phthirusa lepidobotrys is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
